Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness by visa officer
Application_Facts: Visa officer used extrinsic evidence from Plastik without informing applicant
Applicant's role as 'researcher/tutor' was not properly considered
Language assessment requirements under IRPA were not clearly communicated
Defendant_Behavior: Did not allow applicant to respond
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to assess under applicable legislation
Assessment_Factor: Consideration of both old and new immigration acts
Procedural_Issue: Failure to inform applicant of extrinsic evidence
Improper application of language assessment rules
Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections of IRPA relating to procedural fairness and assessment criteria
Governing_Rule: Visa officers must provide notice of extrinsic evidence and allow response; must apply correct legislative framework
Evidentiary_Deficiency: No confirmation of language assessment communication
Harm_Assessment: Applicant denied fair opportunity to respond, leading to unlawful refusal
Cause_Description: Insufficient work experience and lack of proper language assessment
Evidence_Handling: Extrinsic evidence used without disclosure or opportunity to rebut
Evidence_Assessment: Incomplete and unfair evaluation of applicant's qualifications
Decision_Rationale: Visa officer breached procedural fairness in three respects
Applicant entitled to fair process including notice and response opportunity
Decision_Making_Body: Visa officer at Canadian visa office
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to disclose and verify key evidence
